attributes.action: Make it law for councils to immediately house British nationals who are homeless
attributes.additional_details: For too long to many people down on there luck have suffered living on the streets in poor conditions due to not ticking a box on the council list for priority status. I can’t think of more of a priority than a British national who is sleeping rough on the streets with no chance of recovery. The law needs changing to help everyone regardless of sex or marriage/parental status.
attributes.background: Make it law for councils to house British nationals regardless of gender or relationship status, including single men and women.

rejection.details:
Local authorities are already required to prevent and relieve homelessness: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/homelessness-code-of-guidance-for-local-authorities/overview-of-the-homelessness-legislation

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Fund increased housing provision for homeless people: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588351
